details.title: The mean residual life function of a k-out-of-n structure at the system level
details.standardTitle: The mean residual life function of a k-out-of-n structure at the system level

p: Majid Asadi received the Ph.D. degree in statistics from the University of Sheffield, Sheffield, U.K., in 1999.

He is an Associate Professor in the Department of Statistics at the University of Isfahan, Isafahan, Iran. He has published over 20 research papers. His research interests are reliability theory, ordered random variables, information theory, and characterization of probability distributions.

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Stat., Univ. of Isfahan, Iran
authors.name: M. Asadi

p: Ismihan Bayramoglu He received the Ph.D. degree from Kiev University, Ukraine, in 1988.

He is currently a Professor at the Department of Mathematics, Izmir University of Economics, Izmir, Turkey. He is an author or co-author of one book and over 40 published or accepted papers. His research interests are theory of ordered random variables, reliability, multivariate distributions and copulas, characterizations of probability distributions, asymptotic methods in probability and statistics, exceedances, and nonparametric statistics.

details.abstract: In the study of the reliability of technical systems, k-out-of-n systems play an important role. In the present paper, we consider a k-out-of-n system consisting of n identical components with independent lifetimes having a common distribution function F. Under the condition that, at time t, all the components of the system are working, we propose a new definition for the mean residual life (MRL) function of the system, and obtain several properties of that system.

citations.title: The mean residual life function of a k-out-of-n structure at the system level

context.text: Asadi & Bairamov [1] have given an extension of the \$M_{(n)}^{1}(t)\$ as  The \$M_{n}^{k}(t)\$ defined here is in fact the MRL of the system under the condition that at least \$n-k+1\$, \$k=1, 2,\ldots, n\$ components of the system are working, and the other components have already failed.
Several properties of \$M_{n}^{r}(t)\$ are studied in [1].

references.title:
A
note on the mean residual life function of a parallel system
references.text: M. Asadi, I. Bairamov, "A note on the mean residual life function of a parallel system", Communications in Statistics-Theory and Methods, vol. 34, pp. 475-484, 2005.

context.text: See also [2] for a proof of Oakes & Dasu's result under some weaker conditions.\$\hfill\blackbox\$.

references.title:
Some
unified characterization results on the generalized Pareto distribution
references.text: M. Asadi, C. R. Rao, D. N. Shanbhag, "Some unified characterization results on the generalized Pareto distribution", Journal of Statistical Planning and Inference, vol. 93, pp. 29-50, 2001.

context.text: Recently Bairamov [3], under the condition that none of the components of the system fails at time \$t\$, defined the MRL function of a parallel system as  and obtained several properties of it.

The aim of the present paper is to give an extension of the definition of the MRL function proposed by Bairamov [3], in the case where the system has a \$k\$-out-of-\$n\$ structure, and explore some of its properties.

references.title:
A residual life function of a system having parallel or
series structures
references.text: I. Bairamov, M. Ahsanullah, I. Akhundov, "A residual life function of a system having parallel or series structures", Journal of Statistical Theory and Applications, vol. 1, no. 2, pp. 119-132, 2002.

context.text: We refer the reader to Barlow & Proschan [4] for more details on these Concepts, and other classes of life distributions.

references.title: Statistical Theory of Reliability and Life Testing
references.text: R. E. Barlow, F. Proschan, Statistical Theory of Reliability and Life Testing, 1975, Holt, Rinehart, and Winston.

context.text: Belzunce [5] define new aging classes, and provide characterizations for a nonparametric class of life distributions based on aging, and variability orderings of the residual life of \$k\$-out-of-\$n\$ systems.
There is a close relationship between the concept dealt with in the present paper, and residual life discussed in the papers [5], [9], [10], [11].

references.title:
On aging properties based on the residual life of <ref_formula>
<tex>$k$</tex></ref_formula>-out-of- <ref_formula><tex>$n$</tex></ref_formula> systems
references.text: F. Belzunce, M. Franco, J. Ruiz, "On aging properties based on the residual life of \$k\$-out-of- \$n\$ systems", Probability in the Engineering and Informational Sciences, vol. 13, pp. 193-199, 1999.

context.text: The problem to characterize the distributions having a linear regression of E \$(X_{k+m:n}\mid X_{k:n})\$ is completely solved by Dembinska & Wesolowski [6].

references.title: Linearity of regression for nonadjacent order statistics
references.text: A. Dembinska, J. Wesolowski, "Linearity of regression for nonadjacent order statistics", Metrika, vol. 48, pp. 215-222, 1998.

context.text: Ferguson [7] considered the problem of classifying the distributions by linearity of regression of E \$(X_{k+1:n}\mid X_{k:n})\$.

references.title: On characterizing distributions by properties of order statistics
references.text: T. S. Ferguson, "On characterizing distributions by properties of order statistics", Sankhya, vol. 29, pp. 265-278, 1967.

context.text: It is well known that the MRL function \$m(t)\$ characterizes the distribution function \$F\$ uniquely; see, for example, Kotz & Shanbhag [8].

references.title: Some new approaches to probability distributions
references.text: S. Kotz, D. N. Shanbhag, "Some new approaches to probability distributions", Advances in Applied Probability, vol. 12, pp. 903-921, 1980.

context.text: Langberg [9] give characterizations of nonparametric classes of distributions by the stochastic ordering of the residual life of the \$k\$-out-of-\$n\$ system, given that the \$(n-k)\$th failure has occurred at different times.
There is a close relationship between the concept dealt with in the present paper, and residual life discussed in the papers [5], [9], [10], [11].

references.title: Characterizations of nonparametric classes of life distributions
references.text: N. A. Langberg, N. V. Leon, F. Proschan, "Characterizations of nonparametric classes of life distributions", The Annals of Probability, vol. 8, pp. 1163-1170, 1980.

context.text: Recently, Li & Chen [10] studied the aging properties of the residual life length of a \$k\$-out-of-\$n\$ system with independent (not necessarily identical) components given that the \$(n-k)\$th failure has occurred at time \$t\geq 0\$.
There is a close relationship between the concept dealt with in the present paper, and residual life discussed in the papers [5], [9], [10], [11].

references.title:
Aging
properties of the residual life of <ref_formula><tex>$k$</tex></ref_formula>-out-of- <ref_formula>
<tex>$n$</tex></ref_formula> systems with independent but non-identical components
references.text: X. Li, J. Chen, "Aging properties of the residual life of \$k\$-out-of- \$n\$ systems with independent but non-identical components", Applied Stochastic Models in Business and Industry, vol. 20, pp. 143-153, 2004.

context.text: For further results on behaviors of aging properties based upon the residual life of \$k\$-out-of-\$n\$ systems, see Li & Zuo [11].
There is a close relationship between the concept dealt with in the present paper, and residual life discussed in the papers [5], [9], [10], [11].

behaviors of some new aging properties based upon the residual life of <ref_formula>
